result.execSummary:
The defendant Gerald J Ray was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape-Criminal Arrest, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution for Woodman's is to be converted to a civil judgment.

Standard court costs waived by the court. DNA Surcharge to be paid within 90 days or penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Huber - with standard release conditions. To commence forthwith. 27 days credit.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gerald J Ray

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice addressed to: Gerald Ray Return to Sender, Not in Custody, Unable to Forward.

ADDRESS INFO for Gerald J Ray
Current: Unknown,   (Effective: 10-11-2022)
Prior: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States
Letter from Atty Jensen advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.

09:16 AM Defendant Gerald J Ray in court, in custody, with attorney J. Andrew Herbers Jr. for Attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.
Case number 21CM1888 is dismissed and read in to this case.

The defendant was sentenced to the following:

HUBER:  60 days (Credit - 27 days). With standard release conditions. To commence forthwith.

COSTS: Waived; 

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250; to be paid within 90 days or civil judgment will be entered as penalty for non payment.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Restitution in the amount of $276.74 due to Woodman's is ordered in 22CF832 (joint and several).  To be converted to a Civil Judgment forthwith.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 06/27/2022 re: why his walk-a-way charge is not a misdemeanor.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
filed by Atty Herbers requesting a plea/sentencing date. **Reviewed by Judge Lau - Court will hold plea and sentencing on 7/5/22 at 8:30**

08:24 AM Defendant Gerald J Ray in court, in custody, with attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen.   Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Jensen states his client would like to waive the preliminary  hearing set for today. 
Court conducts a colloquy with the defendant as to waiver of preliminary  hearing. 
Defendant states he would waive preliminary hearing. 
  The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.
  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.
State files the information. 
Defense accepts information, waives reading.
  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Bail remains as fixed. 
  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

The Court quashes the warrant.
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.
